question.text:
Read the following statements and choose the correct option.

(i) An increase in melanized moths after industrialization in Great Britain is proof of natural selection.

(ii) When more individuals of a population acquire a mean character value, it is called disruption.

(iii) Changes in allelic frequency in a population will lead to Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.

(iv) Genetic drift changes the existing gene or allelic frequency in future generations.

options.text: only i and iv are correct
only i and ii are correct
only i and iii are correct

solution.text: Natural selection is an important factor for evolution. The classic example is industrial melanism. Before industrial melanism white moth was favored over black or melanized moth by nature but after industrialization due to black soot on the branches the black moth survived well. This shows due to natural selection one type was favored over the other. Such natural selection can be of three types: balancing or stabilizing, disruptive and directional. When more individuals of a population acquire a mean character value, it is called a stabilized population. Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium explains that if there is no change in the frequency of alleles there will be no evolution taking place. But many factors like genetic drift, migration intervenes with the changes in allelic frequency and thus H-W equilibrium is disturbed.
